title: How to Bake a Bride's Cake

steps.headline: Grease and flour two 8-inch round cake pans.
steps.description: Line bottom of pans with parchment paper circles, if desired. Grease and flour the parchment paper using typical cake baking guidelines.

steps.headline: Sift the flour and baking powder together and add to the creamed butter mixture, alternating it with milk.
In a small bowl, beat egg whites until foamy.
steps.description: Be sure to use clean beaters or the egg whites will not beat correctly. Add cream of tartar and beat egg whites until stiff.

steps.headline: Mix in the egg whites with the batter.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until cake layers test done.
steps.description: Use a wooden toothpick or cake tester to check for doneness. The tester should come out clean.

steps.headline: Frost with plain white frosting and decorate as desired.

text: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Grease and flour two 8-inch round cake pans. Line bottom of pans with parchment paper circles, if desired. Grease and flour the parchment paper using typical cake baking guidelines. Cream the butter and sugar.  Sift the flour and baking powder together and add to the creamed butter mixture, alternating it with milk.  In a small bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Be sure to use clean beaters or the egg whites will not beat correctly. Add cream of tartar and beat egg whites until stiff. Mix in the egg whites with the batter. Add the vanilla. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until cake layers test done. Use a wooden toothpick or cake tester to check for doneness. The tester should come out clean. Frost with plain white frosting and decorate as desired. Makes two 8-inch layers.
